conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: walls have height and thickness, multiple faces are visible, and the view is angled with the ceiling/roof removed to expose interior volume.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D wall extrusion and readable interior volumes; clean cutaway. Minor simplification in some corner/edge detailing and openings.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room layout matches (living/dining left, kitchen top-left, utility top-middle, bedroom right, balcony bottom). Toilet area appears geometrically implied but not clearly realized as a distinct, correctly detailed bathroom; some door/opening placements and sizes look simplified vs the plan.

interior_elements.notes: Living, dining, kitchen, utility washer, and bedroom furniture are present and reasonably scaled. Bathroom/toilet fixtures are not clearly present, reducing room identity fidelity.

visual_clarity.notes: Clear materials and readable geometry; good visibility and clean presentation with no interface/text contamination.

detected_errors.description: Toilet/bathroom space from the 2D plan is not clearly distinguished/realized in the 3D model (room identity and/or partitioning/detailing ambiguity).
Door/opening representation is simplified; some openings may not match the exact wall positions/sizes shown in the 2D plan.
Bathroom fixtures (toilet/sink) are missing or not visible, weakening functional accuracy for that room.

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout fidelity, but with notable ambiguity/missing detailing for the toilet/bathroom and simplified openings.
